properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 2:07PM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...EXTENDED PERIOD OF WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES...

.Numerous cold, wet weather systems will continue to push through
the area over the next several days. Colder air is expected to
arrive with each sequential wave, thus snow levels will steadily
lower through the weekend. Many winter weather headlines have been
extended out though Monday, or have been expanded to cover more
area. Winter weather will continue into the middle of next week.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional accumulations of 2 to 3
feet with locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as
high as 55 mph over exposed terrain.

* WHERE...The southern Oregon Cascades, including Crater Lake,
Union Creek, Diamond Lake, and Crescent Lake. Significant
impacts are expected on Highways 138, 230, 62, and 58.

* WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Patchy
blowing snow is expected to significantly reduce visibility.
Gusty winds could bring down trees and power outages are
possible.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is
occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take
protective action now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY
